CalSciPy.io module

CalSciPy.io_tools.load_all_tiffs(folder)[source]

Loads all .tif's within a folder into a single numpy array. Assumes .tif files are the standard unsigned 16-bit exported by the majority (all?) of imaging software.

Parameters

folder (str or pathlib.Path) -- folder containing a sequence of tiff stacks

Returns

a numpy array containing the images (frames, y-pixels, x-pixels)

Return type

numpy.ndarray

CalSciPy.io_tools.load_binary_meta(path)[source]

Loads the meta file for an associated binary video

Parameters

path (str or pathlib.Path) -- The meta file (.txt ext) or a directory containing metafile

Returns

A tuple where (frames, y-pixels, x-pixels, numpy.dtype)

Return type

tuple[int, int, int, str]

CalSciPy.io_tools.load_mapped_binary(path, meta_filename=None, **kwargs)[source]

Loads a raw binary file as numpy array without loading into memory (memmap). Enter a directory to autogenerate the default filenames (binary_video, video_meta.txt)

Parameters

  • path (str or pathlib.Path) -- absolute filepath for binary video or a folder containing a binary video with the default filename

  • meta_filename (Optional[str] = None) -- absolute path to meta file

  • mode -- mode used in loading numpy.memmap (str, default = "r")

Returns

memmap (numpy) array (frames, y-pixels, x-pixels)

Return type

numpy.memmap

CalSciPy.io_tools.load_raw_binary(path, meta_filename=None)[source]

Loads a raw binary file as a numpy array. Enter a directory to autogenerate the default filenames (binary_video, video_meta.txt)

Parameters

  • path (str or pathlib.Path) -- absolute filepath for binary video or directory containing a file named binary video

  • meta_filename (Optional[str] = None) -- absolute path to meta file

Returns

numpy array (frames, y-pixels, x-pixels)

Return type

numpy.ndarray

CalSciPy.io_tools.load_single_tiff(path)[source]

Load a single .tif as a numpy array

Parameters

path (str or pathlib.Path) -- absolute filename

Returns

numpy array (frames, y-pixels, x-pixels)

Return type

numpy.ndarray

CalSciPy.io_tools.save_raw_binary(images, path, meta_filename)[source]

Save a numpy array as a binary file with an associated meta .txt file

Parameters

  • images (numpy.ndarray) -- numpy array (frames, y-pixels, x-pixels)

  • path (str) -- folder to save in or an absolute filepath for binary video file

  • meta_filename (str) -- absolute filepath for saving meta .txt file

Return type

None

CalSciPy.io_tools.save_single_tiff(images, path, type_=<class 'numpy.uint16'>)[source]

Save a numpy array to a single .tif file. Size must be <4 GB.

Parameters

  • images (numpy.ndarray) -- numpy array [frames, y pixels, x pixels]

  • path (str or pathlib.Path) -- filename or absolute path

  • type (Optional[numpy.dtype] = numpy.uint16) -- type for saving

Return type

None

CalSciPy.io_tools.save_tiff_stack(images, output_folder, type_=<class 'numpy.uint16'>)[source]

Save a numpy array to a sequence of .tif stacks

Parameters

  • images (numpy.ndarray) -- numpy array (frames, y-pixels, x-pixels)

  • output_folder (str or pathlib.Path) -- folder to save the sequence of .tif stacks

  • type (Optional[numpy.dtype] = numpy.uint16) -- type for saving

Return type

None

CalSciPy.io_tools.save_video(images, path, fps=30)[source]

Save numpy array as an .mp4. Will be converted to uint8 if any other datatype.

Parameters

  • images (numpy.array) -- numpy array (frames, y-pixels, x-pixels)

  • path (str or pathlib.Path) -- absolute filepath or filename

  • fps (float or int = 30) -- frame rate for saved video

Return type

None
